sen.j: 宇治郡（うじぐん）は、山城国・京都府に存在した郡。
sen.e: Uji District was the district that existed in Yamashiro Province and Kyoto Prefecture.
Uji District was a district that existed in Yamashiro Province and Kyoto Prefecture.
Uji District was a district that existed in Yamashiro Province and Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 郡域は現在の京都市南東部と宇治市東部に相当する。
sen.e: The district area is located in the current southeastern Kyoto and eastern Uji City.
The district area is located in the current southeastern Kyoto and eastern Uji City.
The district area is located in the current southeastern Kyoto City and eastern Uji City.

sen.j: 京都市の南東部では、伏見区と山科区の一部が含まれる。
sen.e: The southeastern Kyoto City has a part of Fushimi and Yamashina Wards.
The southeastern Kyoto City includes a part of Fushimi and Yamashina Wards.
The southeastern Kyoto City includes a part of Fushimi and Yamashina Wards.

sen.j: 秀吉の桜で有名な醍醐寺、浄土真宗の開祖である親鸞が誕生したとされる日野の里、の墓等がある。
sen.e: There are Daigo-ji Temple, which is famous for the cherry tree of Hideyoshi, Hino no Sato (Hino Village) where Shinran, the founder of Pure Land Sect (Buddhism) born, and the grave of SAKATANOUE no Tamumaro.

There is Daigo-ji Temple, which is famous for the cherry tree of Hideyoshi, Hino no Sato (Hino Village) where Shinran, the founder of Pure Land Sect (Buddhism) born, and the grave of SAKATANOUE no Tamumaro.

There are such places as Daigo-ji Temple, which is famous for the cherry tree of Hideyoshi, Hino no Sato (Hino Village) where Shinran, the founder of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) was born, the grave of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, etc.
sen.cmt: 浄土真宗の表現、文法、人名などを修正しました。

sen.j: また、京都府宇治市の東部とは琵琶湖より流れ出る宇治川の右岸地域のこと。
sen.e: In addition, the eastern Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture is the right river bank area of Uji River flowing out from Lake Biwa.
In addition, eastern Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture refers to the right river bank area of Uji River flowing out from Lake Biwa.
In addition, eastern Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture refers to the right river bank area of the Uji-gawa River flowing out from Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: Uji-gawa としました。"Uji-gawa River" -> "the Uji-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: このあたりには、禅宗の一派である黄檗宗の大本山、黄檗山萬福寺等がある。
sen.e: There is Manpuku-ji Temple, which is the main temple of Obaku Sect, one of the Zen Sect, in this surrounding area.
There is Manpuku-ji Temple, which is the main temple of Obaku Sect, one of the Zen Sect, in this surrounding area.
There is Manpuku-ji Temple, which is the main temple of Obaku Sect, one of the Zen sects, in this surrounding area.

sen.j: 万福寺は中国風の建築で有名な寺院。
sen.e: Manpuku-ji is the famous temple with Chinese style architecture.
Manpuku-ji is a famous temple with Chinese style architecture.
Manpuku-ji Temple is a famous temple with Chinese style architecture.

sen.j: 開祖は、インゲンマメや茶を日本に持ち込んだとされる隠元隆き。
sen.e: The founder was Ryuki INGEN, who supposedly brought in Ingenmame (common beans) and tea to Japan.
The founder was Ryuki INGEN, who supposedly brought in Ingenmame (common beans) and tea to Japan.
The founder was Ryuki INGEN, who supposedly brought in Ingenmame (common beans) and tea to Japan.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: Developmental History
Developmental History
History

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）4月10日 - 郡区町村編制法に基づき宇治郡宇治郷に宇治・久世郡両郡合同の郡役所を設置。
sen.e: April 10, 1879: From the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the joint district public office of Uji and Kuse Districts were established in Ujigo of Uji District.

April 10, 1879: From the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the joint district public office of Uji and Kuse Districts were established in Ujigo of Uji District.

April 10, 1879: From the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the joint district public office of Uji and Kuse Districts were established in Uji-go of Uji District.

sen.j: （郡制下では久世郡宇治町に置かれる）
sen.e: (According to the District Alignment Act, it was placed in Uji Town of Kuse District).
(According to the District Alignment Act, it was placed in Uji Town of Kuse District).
(According to the District Alignment Act, it was placed in Uji Town of Kuse District).

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 - 町村制が施行され、宇治郡に宇治村・笠取村・醍醐村・山科村の4村が成立する。
sen.e: April 1, 1889: Town and Village Act was executed, and four villages of Uji, Kasatori, Daigo, and Yamashina Villages were established
April 1, 1889: Town and Village Act was executed, and the four villages of Uji, Kasatori, Daigo, and Yamashina Villages were established
April 1, 1889: Town and Village Act was executed, and the four villages of Uji, Kasatori, Daigo, and Yamashina Villages were established
(Four Villages).
(Four Villages).
(Four villages).

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）10月16日 - 山科村が町制施行。
sen.e: October 16, 1926: Yamashina Village transformed itself into town
October 16, 1926: Yamashina Village transformed itself into a town
October 16, 1926: Yamashina Village transformed itself into a town
(1 town and three villages).
(1 town and three villages).
(One town and three villages).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）4月1日 - 山科町が京都市東山区に編入し、醍醐村が伏見市、紀伊郡深草町・上鳥羽村・吉祥院村・下鳥羽村・横大路村・納所村・堀内村・向島村・竹田村とともに京都市に編入し、伏見区が発足。
sen.e: April 1, 1931: Yamashina Town became a part of Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, and Daigo Village became a part of Fushimi City, and Fukakusa Town of Kii District, villages of Kamitoba, Kisshoin, Shimotoba, Yokooji, Noso, Horinochi, Mukaijima, and Takeda became a part of Kyoto City that Fushimi Ward was established

April 1, 1931: Yamashina Town became a part of Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, and Daigo Village became a part of Fushimi City, and Fukakusa Town of Kii District, villages of Kamitoba, Kisshoin, Shimotoba, Yokooji, Noso, Horinochi, Mukaijima, and Takeda became a part of Kyoto City that Fushimi Ward was established

April 1, 1931: Yamashina Town became a part of Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, and Daigo Village became a part of Fushimi City, and Fukakusa Town of Kii District, villages of Kamitoba, Kisshoin, Shimotoba, Yokooji, Noso, Horiuchi, Mukaijima, and Takeda became a part of Kyoto City and Fushimi Ward was established
(Two villages).
(Two villages).
(Two villages).

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）4月1日 - 笠取村・宇治村が合併し、東宇治町が発足。
sen.e: April 1, 1942: Kasatori and Uji Villages joined together and formed Higashi Uji Town (Eastern Uji Town)
April 1, 1942: Kasatori and Uji Villages joined together and formed Higashi Uji Town (Eastern Uji Town)
April 1, 1942: Kasatori and Uji Villages joined together and formed Higashi Uji Town (Eastern Uji Town)
(1 town).
(1 town).
(One town).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）7月1日 - 久世郡宇治町に宇治郡・久世郡を管轄する宇治地方事務所を設置。
sen.e: July 1, 1942: Uji District Local Office was formed in Uji Town, Kuse District to give a jurisdiction over Uji and Kuse Districts.
July 1, 1942: Uji District Local Office was formed in Uji Town, Kuse District to give jurisdiction over Uji and Kuse Districts.
July 1, 1942: Uji District Local Office was formed in Uji Town, Kuse District to give jurisdiction over Uji and Kuse Districts.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）3月1日 - 東宇治町が久世郡宇治町・槙島村・小倉村・大久保村と合併し、宇治市が発足、郡より離脱したため消滅。
sen.e: March 1, 1951: Higashi Uji Town joined with Uji Town, Kuse District and villages of Ukeshima, Ogura and Ookubo formed Uji City while the Uji District disappeared since it separated from the district.
March 1, 1951: Higashi Uji Town joined with Uji Town, Kuse District and villages of Ukeshima, Ogura and Ookubo formed Uji City while the Uji District disappeared since it separated from the district.

March 1, 1951: Higashi Uji Town joined with Uji Town and villages of Makishima, Ogura and Okubo of Kuse District to form Uji City while the Uji District disappeared since it separated from the district.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳には、山城国宇治郡に以下の大社5座・小社10座の計15座が記載されている。
sen.e: Engishiki Jinmyocho recorded a total of fifteen shrines, five za (unit used to count Buddhist gods or statues) in grand shrine and ten za in lower shines within Uji District, Yamashina Province.
